body:
any idea of which fields are missing? I don't believe the rpm is significantly malformed as I manually checked some on fedora when we were still working on the migration...

cc/ @djgilcrease as well

I do not. I will try poking around the RPM metadata from a pre-0.120
version for comparison and let you know if I find anything.

On Mon, Nov 4, 2019 at 6:05 PM Carlos Alexandro Becker <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> any idea of which fields are missing? I don't believe the rpm is
> significantly malformed as I manually checked some on fedora when we were
> still working on the migration...
>
> cc/ @djgilcrease <https://github.com/djgilcrease> as well
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/1229?email_source=notifications&email_token=AAC4GA2GSIW53R7MIF2OUDLQSDIFBA5CNFSM4JI4MHRKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOEDBLFPY#issuecomment-549630655>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAC4GA62AWS5J3NEFWABNR3QSDIFBANCNFSM4JI4MHRA>
> .
>

A quick peek with `rpm -qpi`:

GOOD (v0.119.0):
```
Name        : pauditd
Version     : 1.1.11_next
Release     : 1
Architecture: x86_64
Install Date: (not installed)
Group       : Development/Tools
Size        : 9052160
License     : MIT
Signature   : (none)
Source RPM  : pauditd-1.1.11_next-1.src.rpm
Build Date  : Mon Nov  4 18:12:08 2019
Build Host  : MacBook-Pro
Relocations : (not relocatable)
Packager    : engineering <engineering@pantheon.io>
URL         : https://github.com/pantheon-systems/pauditd
Summary     : go alternative to auditd
Description :
go alternative to auditd
```

BAD (v0.120.3):
```
Name        : pauditd
Version     : 1.1.11-next
Release     : 1
Architecture: x86_64
Install Date: (not installed)
Group       : 
Size        : 9052160
License     : MIT
Signature   : (none)
Source RPM  : pauditd-1.1.11-next-1.src.rpm
Build Date  : (none)
Build Host  : (none)
Relocations : (not relocatable)
Packager    : engineering <engineering@pantheon.io>
Vendor      : Pantheon Systems
URL         : https://github.com/pantheon-systems/pauditd
Summary     : (none)
Description :
(none)
```

A `diff` view of the above:
```patch
--- good	2019-11-04 18:13:12.000000000 -0800
+++ bad	2019-11-04 18:13:17.000000000 -0800
@@ -1,18 +1,19 @@
 Name        : pauditd
-Version     : 1.1.11_next
+Version     : 1.1.11-next
 Release     : 1
 Architecture: x86_64
 Install Date: (not installed)
-Group       : Development/Tools
+Group       : 
 Size        : 9052160
 License     : MIT
 Signature   : (none)
-Source RPM  : pauditd-1.1.11_next-1.src.rpm
-Build Date  : Mon Nov  4 18:12:08 2019
-Build Host  : MacBook-Pro
+Source RPM  : pauditd-1.1.11-next-1.src.rpm
+Build Date  : (none)
+Build Host  : (none)
 Relocations : (not relocatable)
 Packager    : engineering <engineering@pantheon.io>
+Vendor      : Pantheon Systems
 URL         : https://github.com/pantheon-systems/pauditd
-Summary     : go alternative to auditd
+Summary     : (none)
 Description :
-go alternative to auditd
+(none)
```

I haven't used any of these tools before but they'll be my next attempt at comparing the headers: http://ftp.rpm.org/max-rpm/s1-rpm-file-format-rpm-tools.html
Tools For Studying RPM Files

OK, here we go:

## group

we had a default before, need to add it back probably:

```
{{- with .Info.Overridables.RPM.Group }}
Group: {{ . }}
{{- else }}
Group: Development/Tools
{{- end }}
```

## build data and build host

I guess rpmbuild adds them, we may need to add them as well...

## vendor

should be fine having it now even though we didn't had it before.

## summary

we used to default to the first line of the description, I guess this one is also a problem:

```
Summary: {{ first_line .Info.Description }}
```

Will work on these on nfpm.

There is a `HEADER TAGS` section of this doc which has a list of required -vs- optional header tags: https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/Fedora_Draft_Documentation/0.1/html/RPM_Guide/ch-package-structure.html Constant | Value | Type | Required? -- | -- | -- | -- RPMTAG_NAME | 1000 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_VERSION | 1001 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_RELEASE | 1002 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_SUMMARY | 1004 | I18NSTRING | Yes RPMTAG_DESCRIPTION | 1005 | I18NSTRING | Yes RPMTAG_BUILDTIME | 1006 | INT32 | Optional RPMTAG_BUILDHOST | 1007 | STRING | Optional RPMTAG_SIZE | 1009 | INT32 | Yes RPMTAG_LICENSE | 1014 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_GROUP | 1016 | I18NSTRING | Yes RPMTAG_OS | 1021 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_ARCH | 1022 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_SOURCERPM | 1044 | STRING | Optional RPMTAG_FILEVERIFYFLAGS | 1045 | INT32 | Optional RPMTAG_ARCHIVESIZE | 1046 | INT32 | Optional RPMTAG_RPMVERSION | 1064 | STRING | Optional RPMTAG_CHANGELOGTIME | 1080 | INT32 | Optional RPMTAG_CHANGELOGNAME | 1081 | STRING_ARRAY | Optional RPMTAG_CHANGELOGTEXT | 1082 | STRING_ARRAY | Optional RPMTAG_COOKIE | 1094 | STRING | Optional RPMTAG_OPTFLAGS | 1122 | STRING | Optional RPMTAG_PAYLOADFORMAT | 1124 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_PAYLOADCOMPRESSOR | 1125 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_PAYLOADFLAGS | 1126 | STRING | Yes RPMTAG_RHNPLATFORM | 1131 | STRING | Deprecated RPMTAG_PLATFORM | 1132 | STRING | Optional A few required tags that might be missing based on the `rpm -qpi` output: - Group - Summary - Description
Chapter 24. RPM Package File Structure

yep, seems like!

will require a PR on rpmpack as well, already WIP


thanks for reporting this :)

issue.title: feat: add description, summary, build time and build host tags

repository.name: rpmpack
repository.description: rpmpack (tar2rpm) - package rpms in pure golang or cli

issue.body:
according to [this](https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/Fedora_Draft_Documentation/0.1/html/RPM_Guide/ch-package-structure.html), both are required tags and we are not setting them...

refs https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/1229

repository.name: nfpm
repository.description: nFPM is Not FPM - a simple deb, rpm, apk, ipk, and arch linux packager written in Go

issue.title: validate required fields

repository.name: nfpm
repository.description: nFPM is Not FPM - a simple deb, rpm, apk, ipk, and arch linux packager written in Go

issue.body:
maybe we should add a step to validate that required fields were provided?

I'm not sure about debs, but RPMs seem to like to complain about missing required fields :) 

see https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/1229 for more context

Not sure what the issue may be at this point. Perhaps missing build date and build host, although those are marked as optional tags

yeah, diff shows less things now:

```diff
2c2
< Version     : 1.1.11_next
---
> Version     : 1.1.11-next
10,12c10,12
< Source RPM  : pauditd-1.1.11_next-1.src.rpm
< Build Date  : Mon Nov  4 18:12:08 2019
< Build Host  : MacBook-Pro

> Build Date  : (none)
> Build Host  : (none)
14a15
> Vendor      : Pantheon Systems
19d19
<
```
not sure about the `_next` vs `-next` thing 🤔
can you try to generate a pkg with a tag without `-next` to see how it goes?

at this point I'm pretty sure that is it, we used to have this on nfpm:

```go
info.Version = strings.Replace(info.Version, "-", "_", -1)
```

and I remember rpmbuild would complain otherwise...

issue.title: fix(rpm): with defaults: fix version and pre-release

repository.name: nfpm
repository.description: nFPM is Not FPM - a simple deb, rpm, apk, ipk, and arch linux packager written in Go

issue.body:
refs https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/1229#issuecomment-549659537

~~not sure this is the right way to go, I'm sleepy and will check again tomorrow :)~~

fixed in a more proper way, moved the version parse to `WithDefaults`.

body:
although I think that what should actually happen is: 

```
Version     : 1.1.11
Release     : next
```

Got it, it happens if we call nfpm binary, but using as an API it doesn't, because the check is on the yaml parser func.

Will work on a proper fix tomorrow.
